name: Eastern Cottonwood
climate: This tree thrives in temperate climates where seasons are distinct.
It can also tolerate subtropical regions if conditions are suitable.
Eastern Cottonwood does best in regions with moderate rainfall.
It is ideally suited to areas with hot summers and cold winters.
sunlight: Eastern Cottonwood requires full sun exposure to grow optimally.
It thrives best in areas that receive at least six hours of direct sunlight.
Partial shade can be tolerated, but growth may be limited.
The tree grows poorly in shaded areas with minimal sunlight exposure.
watering: This species prefers consistently moist soil for ideal growth.
It can tolerate occasional dry spells once fully established.
Frequent watering is necessary in the first few years of growth.
Roots need access to water, especially in arid environments.
soil: Eastern Cottonwood thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soil.
It can grow in various soil types, including sandy and clay soils.
Acidic, neutral, or alkaline soil pH is generally acceptable.
Soil should remain consistently moist, yet not waterlogged.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning is recommended to maintain tree shape and health.
Monitor for pests such as aphids, which can affect growth.
Avoid planting near sewer lines or sidewalks due to aggressive roots.
Fertilize lightly during the growing season to support strong growth.
